sentences.en: A rat squeaked and ran into the bushes.
sentences.cn: 一只老鼠吱吱叫着跑进了灌木丛。
他发出一声愤怒的尖叫。

sentences.en: He managed to squeak by [ through ] somehow.
sentences.cn: 他 总算 想办法对付过去了.

sentences.en: I don't want to hear another squeak out of you!
I had a squeak of it.
I heard the squeak of a mouse.
sentences.cn: 我听到一只老鼠吱吱的叫声.
我的新皮鞋走路嘎吱嘎吱响。

sentences.en: She interrupted herself after demonstrating the squeak by saying she had to go and write something down, thus suggesting that she might not have finished the demonstration.
sentences.cn: 当演示完吱吱声后，她停了下来，说自己有事得走了，并在纸上写下了些东西，以此暗示也许她还没完成整个过程。

sentences.en: squeaked through the test; squeaks by on a limited income.
sentences.cn: 勉强通过考试；依靠一点有限的收入生活

sentences.en: The bill passed by a narrow squeak.
The room was full of the bubble and the squeak conversation.
sentences.cn: 屋内充满了叽叽咕咕的谈话声.

sentences.en: Their wooden clogs squeak in the snow.
sentences.cn: 他们的木底鞋踩在雪地上吱吱嗄嗄直响.
新鞋子走起路来咯吱咯吱地响.

sentences.en: This moth's ear is tuned in to the bat's ultrasonic squeak.
sentences.cn: 这种蛾的耳朵能收听到蝙蝠的超音速的尖叫声.

sentences.en: We won the game, but it was a narrow squeak.
sentences.cn: 我们打赢了这场球赛, 不过是侥幸取胜.

sentences.en: We've pulled you through a tight squeak.
sentences.cn: 我们侥幸地助你通过了难关.

sentences.en: When I entered the room, Little Tom gave a startled squeak.
sentences.cn: 我进屋的时候, 小汤姆吓了一跳哇哇地哭了.

sentences.en: With a third group, she activated the squeak as if by accident.
sentences.cn: 对于第三组孩子，她展示发出吱吱声好像意外发出一样。

words.tran_cn: 雏鸽；小猪；咬臼者；吱吱叫的东西；发出短促刺耳声的人（或物）

phrases.tran_cn: 险些：设法通过、战胜或活下来

trans.tran_cn: 短促的尖叫声，吱吱的叫声，尖厉刺耳的噪音，机会
trans.tran_en: a very short high noise or cry
to succeed, win, or pass a test by a very small amount so that you only just avoid failure

trans.tran_cn: 短促地尖叫，吱吱叫，发出尖厉刺耳的噪音，告密
以尖厉的声音说话，使发出吱吱声
